data.title: Becky G, Don Omar and Christian Nodal Headline the Return of Los Dells Festival for New Home in San Bernardino, California
data.meta_description: After a two year hiatus due to Covid-19, Los Dells returns as a one-day event for the first time at San Bernardino's N.O.S. Event Center.
data.text:
Audio version of the article can be listened to in the player below

After a two-year break due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Los Dells Festival returns on April 2, 2022 as a one-day event with a new scenic backdrop, but continues to cater to all styles and origins for a multi-genre Latin Music experience.

The fourth installment will now take place for the first time at San Bernardino’s N.O.S. Events Center in California after a 3-stint run in Wisconsin. Headliners this year will include 3-time Latin Grammy Award winner and acclaimed regional Mexican artist Christian Nodal, Puerto Rican singer, songwriter and rapper Don Omar, singer, songwriter, actor and activist Becky G, and award-winning boy band CNCO.

Joining the festival are Eladio Carrion, Sofia Reyes, Adriel Favela, Ally Brooke, Banda Renovación, El Gran Silencio, Siddhartha, Silvan Estra, YEͶDRY, Ana Tijoux, Chesca, Sofía Valdés, Fuerza De Tijuana, Jesús Mendoza, Monogem, Andrez Babii, with more artists to be announced soon.

The festival will continue the Latin celebration through food, craft beers, and Los Dells’ El Mercadito (marketplace) for hand-made arts and crafts. In addition, the festival will highlight local and regional artists from painting, sculpture, drawing and mixed media.

Tickets are on sale now with General Admission tickets starting at $99 and VIP tickets at $175, while supplies last. Please visit www.losdells.com for tickets and more information.

Please note: The festival will have water stations on site and will allow the use of concert goers to bring a reusable plastic water bottle.

Attendees are not required to be vaccinated, but proof of vaccination or proof of a negative COVID-19 test taken within 24 hours (antigen test) or 48 hours (PCR test) is needed to attend Los Dells. If you are unable to take a test prior to festival day, they will provide free antigen testing on site starting at 10am.
